quest.name: The Hardened Heart
journal: Sul Oul seems rather more pleased to entertain you than Granson.

Having finally completed your respective tasks, you and Granson bid Sul Oul to tell you what they know of Branden, the former Warrior of Light. However, the Nu Mou's fond words for the fallen knight spur Granson to lash out in anger, as he is unwilling to think of the man as anything but the eater he has become. The Nu Mou regards him quietly for a moment before inviting the two of you to accompany them to Lyhe Ghiah to hear a story...

In the ruins of the ancient castle of Lyhe Ghiah, Sul Oul regales you with the tale of Branden and the lady Sauldia. The young knight served as the princess's bodyguard for a time, until he failed in his duty to protect her during one of her many “investigations.” Though she would make a full recovery, Branden was nevertheless stripped of his knighthood and cast out...only to return one day, a grizzled adventurer in the company of fledgling heroes. Together they sought to identify the culprit behind the mysterious transformations which had continued unabated in Branden's absence. And so their search would lead them to the viper in their midst...

Tadric, court mage and loyal servant of the royal family, was the architect of Voeburt's misery. Consumed by pride and jealousy, he had orchestrated the transformations in an effort to throw the kingdom into chaos that he might claim Voeburt's throne for himself. Though the Warriors of Light succeeded in putting an end to his ambitions, their victory was marred by tragedy when Tadric, in a final act of spite before he breathed his last, cursed Sauldia like he had so many others, condemning her to a fate worse than death. Through the power of the Echo, you bear witness to the court mage's final moments...as well as hers, as Branden carries out her final order, and releases her from her torment...

Good and evil, right and wrong. There is a comfort in simplicity. Granson had convinced himself that Branden was the villain of his personal story─that his tragedy could have meaning and purpose so long as he saw it through to the proper conclusion. But life is not a faerie tale, and Branden was a man like any other, full of hopes and dreams and regrets...including one which mirrored the hunter's own. Unsure how to reconcile this truth, Granson asks for a moment to think on his path. For indeed, if we are not who we believe ourselves to be...then who are we?

※The next role quest will be available from Sul Oul upon reaching level 80 in any tank class.
objectives: Rendezvous with Sul Oul at Lyhe Ghiah.
Speak with Sul Oul at Pla Enni.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Acht-la Ormh Inn.”

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Exemplary timing, Forename. 'Twas not more than a moment ago that Granson returned, having at last obliged my humble request.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Humble request my arse. This one's no better than a Eulmoran aristocrat, so accustomed to making others do their bidding. I tell you, there's something off-putting about taking orders from a dog─

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Ere you continue and give me cause to reconsider aiding your hunt, perhaps you should ask your questions.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Fine. Forename said shehe saw a vision of you and Branden looking thick as thieves. You were friends, eh? Know what he's up to now?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Branden is dead. He died a century ago, together with his comrades in an attempt to halt the Flood that they themselves set in motion. I presume you speak of the eater that took possession of his corpse.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Dikaiosyne, aye. But unlike most eaters, he's been doing more than roam about aimlessly. For some reason he's been hunting down royal treasures of old Voeburt...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: ...And he's been killing anyone who got in his way.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Is he now? Heh, what irony. Even in death he remains a slave to duty. A knight brave and true─

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: He's a murderer, and I'll not hear it said otherwise. He ruined my life─killed my beloved right before my very eyes! Every night I go to bed dreaming of the day I'll take my revenge.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: ...Oh. I see. Truly, you have suffered a terrible loss...but while your thirst for vengeance is quite natural and understandable, it is ultimately misguided.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Unusual behavior notwithstanding, Dikaiosyne is nevertheless no more than an eater. To hate him is to hate the sea that claims the ship─the disease that steals the child, the tremor that topples the home. The mindless force of nature that begets destruction, driven by fragmented memory─

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Don't you dare make excuses for him! You think I wanted any of this!? I grew up on a farm. I could barely wield a sword! And now I've got to kill one of the bloody Cardinal Virtues!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Hate and anger and vengeance are all I've got now! My every waking moment is dedicated to plotting his death. It has to be! It has to be!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: So just tell us where the godsdamned ring is and we'll be on our way!

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: This is how it has to be, hmm? Who you have to be?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Nay, I think not. You ask too much─demand far, far too much─and in exchange for what? This I cannot abide.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Are you trying to barter with me!? You little shite─tell me what I want to know or I'll beat it out of you!

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Back off, Forename! I won't let anyone or anything stand between me and Milinda's murderer!

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: ...Branden was a dear friend. To know that an eater disgraces his flesh and his memory pains me more than I can well express.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: It would bring me great comfort if you were to grant him peace.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: I should like to share with you a story. If you would be so kind as to join me in Lyhe Ghiah...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: This had better have a point...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Oh, you've returned. They made me go and gather a bunch of strange mushrooms, so hopefully we can finally get some answers...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: 'Tis beautiful, even now. A palace of forgotten dreams. But before it was Lyhe Ghiah, in the time of Voeburt, it was Gruenes Licht.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: The memory of mine in which you walked was of a troubled time, when the people of our kingdom were preyed upon by an ambitious fool...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Branden, then a young knight who had only just won his spurs, had caught the eye of Princess Sauldia, who chose him as her personal guardian. However, he was far too inexperienced, and was unable to keep her safe when she ventured outside these walls on one of her “investigations.”

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: For his failure, he was stripped of his knighthood, and shortly thereafter he quit Voeburt. I thought I would never see him again...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: But then, one day, he returned─one of several wandering adventurers led by a man named Ardbert, who had accepted our invitation to look into the mysterious transformations, which had continued unabated in Branden's absence.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Lady Sauldia was overjoyed, and for a time it was like nothing had changed. They spoke often and grew even closer...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: And then came the day when we learned the truth─

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: When we learned that the architect of our kingdom's suffering was none other than the court mage, Tadric...

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: It's him, Branden. I'm sorry.

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: ...So am I. Come─let's have done with it.

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: It was you, Tadric─do not deny it! Tormenting our people, twisting and transforming them into monsters...and for what!?

dialogue.name: TADRIC
dialogue.text: Branden, Branden, Branden. And after I took such pains to be rid of you...

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: You may strip me of my titles but not my oaths. I shall serve Lady Sauldia till my dying breath!

dialogue.name: TADRIC
dialogue.text: As you like. Once I have killed you and your friends, there will be no one left to stop me from claiming the throne!

dialogue.name: TADRIC
dialogue.text: Hear me, my children! The hour of reckoning is at hand! Rejoice, for in noble sacrifice shall you find everlasting glory!

dialogue.name: YOUNGMAGE03247
dialogue.text: Lord Tadric, it...it hurts...

dialogue.name: TADRIC
dialogue.text: Soon you shall know no more pain.

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: I was going to make it quick. For old times' sake. But now...now I think I ought to take my time...

dialogue.name: TADRIC
dialogue.text: Meddlesome wretch! This kingdom is by rights mine!

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: Branden? What is the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: Tadric, you... But why, after serving us faithfully for so many years─

dialogue.name: TADRIC
dialogue.text: I am no servant! No servant! Not of your mother or father...or you!

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: My lady!

dialogue.name: WARRIOROFDARKNESS
dialogue.text: Godsdamn you!

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: Lady Sauldia! Speak to me!

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: Branden. My dear, brave Branden... Am I...your princess still? Would you honor your vows, even now?

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: Now and ever after, my lady. My sword is yours to command.

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: That...that is well. Would that I had the strength to wield it myself...

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: Steel your heart, brave Branden, and for the good of Voeburt...and her people...

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: No...no, no! I cannot! I will not!

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: Honor your vows. To your kingdom... To your princess...

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: (-Sauldia-)To...to your friend... Who never doubted you. Who knew...knew that you...would return...and see justice...justice...

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: ...No. It should be me.

dialogue.name: SAULDIA
dialogue.text: (-Sauldia-)Branden...my sword...now and...ever after...

dialogue.name: CYLVA
dialogue.text: We've rounded up the rest of Tadric's co-conspirators and tossed them in the gaol. The ones who hadn't been corrupted by his magicks, that is...

dialogue.name: BRANDEN
dialogue.text: I'll not hesitate again. No matter the cost─no matter the sacrifice...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Well? You saw what happened?

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Wicked white. She begged him to do it. Like Milinda...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Come. Let us quit this place and return to Pla Enni.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: Why are we here again?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Do you know why I entered into the royal family's service many long years ago?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Because when I was attacked by a wild beast which nearly tore me to shreds, it was Lady Sauldia who came to my rescue.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: She saved me─and that is a debt that can never be repaid, for there is naught in this world which holds greater value than life itself.

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Not even her death absolves me of it, and so I must always first consider her wishes, her desires─what she would want for me and her kingdom. For Branden, and yes, even for you, Granson...

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: For me...?

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: To define oneself in opposition to the other─an other bereft of complexity of nuance, wholly devoid of redeeming qualities. A villain. Indeed, there is comfort and certainty in hatred...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: But it is a false and fleeting comfort. Bought with lies we tell ourselves about who we are, what we must be, what we must do. And never you mind the cost─if anything, the more we offer up in sacrifice, the better!

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Do you not see? Branden was right to hesitate. To doubt. The unwavering blade cares not whom it serves nor who it cuts.

dialogue.name: GRANSON
dialogue.text: I...I think I need a moment...

dialogue.name: SULOUL
dialogue.text: Perhaps you do as well. Leave us for now, Forename.
